Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 52411: Direct Life, Health, and Medical Insurance Carriers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Highmark, Inc., an insurance company headquartered in Pittsburgh, agreed to pay the United States $1.5 million to settle False Claims Act allegations.

To resolve a case involving allegations of unfair health insurance reimbursement rates, HealthNow agreed to pay $212,500 to a qualified nonprofit organization that would establish a new, independent database to help determine fair out-of-network reimbursement rates for consumers throughout the United States.

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Info Source: New York Fines HealthNow $1 Million Following Probe of Infertility Treatment Denial, Bestwire, July 23, 2008 (via Nexis).
Notes: At the time of this case the agency was known as the New York Insurance Department.

Description: New York State authorities ordered 11 insurance companies to refund a total of $114.5 million to holders of policies that covered 573,748 people who were overcharged for health insurance premiums in 2010.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: The Department of Financial Services fined a group of insurance companies a total of $2.7 million for failing to notify small businesses that they were eligible to buy special insurance coverage for mental illnesses and children with serious emotional disturbances.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: HealthNow New York Inc. was fined $700,000 for failing to explain coverage and benefit rights to certain health plan members and for failing to tell members how to appeal claims denials.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: HealthNow New York Inc. agreed to pay a $750,000 fine for violating New York State regulations with respect to its small group policy renewal program.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
New York Department of Financial Services

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
